messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] "Growing Without Schooling" Subscriber List
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks Sandra! I was not comfortable with that part(secondary publishing) either.  Now that I have just found out about HomeEd - I need to check it out.  GWS
messages.messageBody:
Thanks Sandra! I was not comfortable with that part(secondary publishing) either. Now that I have just found out about HomeEd - I need to check it out. GWS going out left a big hole for me. I am new to this list and need to check out all of the resources. I haven't had a chance to do that yet. It's been a busy week!

But then the list will be there years after the people agreed to have it
published. Sending an address to a periodical to which you've subscribed
isn't the same as agreeing to have it published on the internet for years.

I don't think it's a good idea to publish those secondarily.


~~~ Don't forget! If you change the topic, change the subject line! ~~~

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] "Growing Without Schooling" Subscriber List
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/12/02 9:37:05 AM, rambler@planetcomm.net writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/12/02 9:37:05 AM, rambler@... writes:

<< If you can fax me a copy of
that list (see my # in the signature at the end of this message), I'll put
the entire list on a database and put it in the "files" area of this
YahooGroup, so that anyone can download it (databases can be opened by
MS-Works, MS-Excel, Word, Wordperfect, and many other programs) and search
it for people nearby. >>

But then the list will be there years after the people agreed to have it
published. Sending an address to a periodical to which you've subscribed
isn't the same as agreeing to have it published on the internet for years.

I don't think it's a good idea to publish those secondarily.

messages.subject: "Growing Without Schooling" Subscriber List
messages.msgSnippet: Deborah, I had no idea such a magazine even existed.  If you can fax me a copy of that list (see my # in the signature at the end of this message), I ll put
messages.messageBody:
Deborah,

I had no idea such a magazine even existed. If you can fax me a copy of
that list (see my # in the signature at the end of this message), I'll put
the entire list on a database and put it in the "files" area of this
YahooGroup, so that anyone can download it (databases can be opened by
MS-Works, MS-Excel, Word, Wordperfect, and many other programs) and search
it for people nearby.

It might be nice to have some way of adding the people on this and any
other unschooling lists onto such a database as well.

-- Marc Montoni

>________________________________________________________________________
>
>From: "Deborah Eiseman" <deborah.eiseman@...>
>Subject: Re: Re: SOS
>
>To the McPhersons:
>I do not still have your original message (sorry) and that probably
>had your email address in it - so I can't ask you this question other
>than on the list. I happen to have the last issue of "Growing Without
>Schooling" (fantastic mag - SO sad they're gone) that had the annual
>list of subscribers. (Jan/Feb 2001) If you do not have access to
>that and would like to see if there are families in your area, I would
>be happy to help. Just send me a personal email with your zip code and
>I'll be happy to send you the names and addresses of the families whose
>zips are closest to yours. (Knowing the name of the town might also
>make it easier for me to scan (there's 1.3 columns of names for VA
>and it's fairly small print - so maybe there'll be a lead!)
>Good luck! Support really helps as we seem to be rather different
>than mainstream culture. The people who post here are a great help
>that way, too.
>Deborah
>
>________________________________________________________________________






-- Marc Montoni
